reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General reports to the Council by 30 June 2009
summary:
8. Encourages troop and police contributing countries to heighten awareness and responsiveness of their personnel to protect civilians.

9. Requests Secretary-General to develop guidelines and strategies to enhance protection of civilians from sexual violence.

10. Requests Secretary-General and UN agencies to develop mechanisms to provide protection from violence to women and girls.

11. Stresses the role of the Peacebuilding Commission in addressing sexual violence in post-conflict peacebuilding.

12. Urges Secretary-General and his Special Envoys to invite women to participate in conflict prevention and resolution discussions.

13. Urges parties to support development of national institutions and local civil society networks to assist victims of sexual violence.

14. Urges regional and sub-regional bodies to develop policies and activities to benefit women and girls affected by sexual violence.

15. Requests Secretary-General to submit a report by 30 June 2009 on implementation of this resolution.
The Security Council 

15. Urges parties to conflict to be strictly complying with their obligations under international humanitarian law and international human rights law, in particular in protecting civilians, including women and girls, from all forms of gender-based violence; 

16. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
